Hundreds of monkeys make for quite a scene and after were off to Ubud's charming artisan market.

day8.title: Balinese Cooking Class
day8.desc: Time to get to know the locals. This starts with a local family who invites us into their home for a traditional Balinese cooking class. Before the class begins is the blessing ceremony - a truly unique experience!

day9.title: Waterfalls, School & Elephant Cave
day9.desc: Today is about exploring Ubud's scenery, people, and ancient history. After breakfast, we volunteer time at a local school to play games, help with English-speaking lessons, and experience day-to-day life for this curious group of smiley students. Then we head to Air Tegungan Waterfalls to swim and explore this jaw-dropping spectacle. Finish with a visit to the 9th-century temple of Goa Gajah - also known as Elephant Cave. This is a UNESCO World Heritage Site that was not fully unearthed until the 1950s.

day10.title: River Rafting & Kecak Fire Dance
day10.desc: This Bali trip has it all! This is an all-new addition to the tour and is just the right amount of adventure for first-time river rafters. This is a casual two-hour raft along the river through the dense jungle surrounding this entire stunning area. Then, back for some poolside relaxation at our hotel before heading to a local temple to watch a traditional Kecak Fire Dance. Ubud is pure magic and you are seeing the best this jungle paradise has to offer.

day11.title: Goin' To Gili T(rawangan)
day11.desc: No trip to Bali is complete without a visit to the island paradise of Gili Trawangan! When you think of Bali with the perfect beaches, picturesque sea swings at sunset, teal waters, and buzzing nightlife, Gili T is likely the place you have in mind. Settle in and relax. This is where you will home for the next unforgettable four nights.

day12.title: Snorkeling With Sea Turtles
day12.desc: The time has come to check "swim with sea turtles" off your bucket list! We make a day of it with a full-on island-hopping adventure. Sea turtles are the highlight, of course, but you will also get a day of swimming, sun, and fun - including a lunchtime feast aboard our private boat. Bali days are the best days, indeed!

day13.title: Gili T Beach Day & Bike Ride
day13.desc: Nothing beats beach days in Bali! Catch some sun, rent a paddleboard, jungle trek, hop on the bike, sample the local seafood, and enjoy one of Bali's most laidback settings. This is a backpacker hotspot with no shortage of ways to spend a day. Beachside beers or beverages suggested but not mandatory. And the hotel pool is also a top option!

day14.title: Good Times In Gili Trawangan
day14.desc: Your last day in Gili T is yours to spend as you please! There are many options... we suggest, you decide. The best spot to be is on the beach or in the sea soaking in the picture-perfect place you've called home over the last four days. Scratch that. There is no bad way to spend this day but that's a good place to start.

day15.title: Tegagalang Rice Terrace & Holy Springs
day15.desc: All those photos of those stunning rice fields in Bali? This is the place! After departing Gili, we jump in the private vans to head off the beaten track to our mountainside retreat. On the way, we stop at the rolling rice fields of Tegagalang Rice Terrace. Then to one of the most iconic temples in all of Bali to take a sin-cleansing dip in the holy springs of Pura Tirta Empul and the sacred water that bubbles up from below.

day16.title: Stunning Sekumpul Waterfall
day16.desc: Hidden away in the jungle is the jaw-dropping Sekumpul Waterfalls! Widely regarded as "the most beautiful waterfall in Bali", we spend the morning trekking, swimming, and exploring the basin of several rivers that feed the waterfalls streaming down from above - one waterfall from up to 80 metres high. Then, off to our mountainside camping spot for a campfire, BBQ, and ultra-unique camping experience.

day17.title: Ulun Danu Temple On Lake Beratan
day17.desc: Start the morning exploring one of the holiest temples in Bali! Then off to Seminyak for a final beach and pool day. Finish with sunset on the beach and farewell feast. Seminyak is a lazy, little beach town with all the ingredients for a successful chill day. Wrap things up with a picture-perfect sunset (and cocktails) on the beautiful beach followed by a complimentary Balinese feast for the group's farewell dinner (and night out together).

day18.title: Farewell, For Now
day18.desc: Your Bali trip is complete! Enjoy a final breakfast together and say your farewells and 'until-next-times' before catching your airport transfer and flight home - or heading off to continue your travels. Your tour is now complete but your Bali adventure will stick with you for a lifetime.

seo_data.meta_title: 12 Day Bali Group Tour | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: From temple trails to surf breaks, Bali is a spiritual and adventure-packed island paradise.

open_graph.title: 12 Day Express Group Adventure Tour in Bali with Beaches & Temples | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: From temple trails to surf breaks, Bali is a spiritual and adventure-packed island paradise.

tour_information.description: From temple trails to surf breaks, Bali is a spiritual and adventure-packed island paradise.
activities_incl: Snorkeling trip (Mantra Rays are not always guaranteed)
Private Island Hopping around Gili Islands

day1.title: Touchdown in Canggu
day1.desc: Welcome to Bali! Land in the tropical beach town of Canggu and settle into your hotel near the coast. Hit the rooftop for a sunset drink and meet your new crew over a delicious group dinner. The good vibes start now!

day2.title: Surf’s Up in Paradise
day2.desc: Grab your board and hit the waves with expert surf coaches. Whether you’re a beginner or pro, today’s about soaking up the stoke. After lunch, chill at the beach, take a yoga class, or explore Canggu’s cafés. Wrap it up by checking out your surf shots from earlier!

day3.title: Scenic Drive to Pemuteran
day3.desc: Road trip time! Wind your way north through lush landscapes to the peaceful coastal village of Pemuteran. Check in to your eco-lodge, unwind by the sea, or take a walk through the sleepy local streets. Tonight, relax and reset before tomorrow’s big adventure.

day4.title: Reefs & Wildlife in Menjangan
day4.desc: Hop on a boat to explore Menjangan Island, a marine paradise in Bali’s national park. Snorkel vibrant coral reefs and maybe spot a deer or two onshore. We’ll also stop by the BioRock Project, the world’s largest coral restoration site, to see how Bali is protecting its underwater world.

day5.title: Jungle Vibes & Waterfalls
day5.desc: Start the day at the hidden gem of Banyumala Waterfalls, surrounded by jungle. Then, visit a local family who’ll show you how they’ve been roasting coffee the traditional way for generations. Later, arrive in Ubud, Bali’s cultural heart, and explore the markets or take it easy.

day6.title: Monkeys, Rice Fields and Purification
day6.desc: Wander through the magical Monkey Forest, then visit the famous rice terraces of Tegallalang. At the Tirta Empul water temple, take part in a traditional purification ritual. The rest of the day is yours to explore Ubud’s yoga studios, cafés, or spas.

day7.title: Sunrise Trek up Mt Batur
day7.desc: Rise early for an epic sunrise hike up Mt Batur. After a steep but short trek, sip coffee at the summit with panoramic views of the volcanic landscape. After descending, head back to Ubud for a lazy afternoon, maybe a massage, poolside chill, or smoothie bowl session.

day8.title: Nusa Penida Bound
day8.desc: Catch a boat to the epic island of Nusa Penida. Spend the day checking out the island’s showstoppers from the famous T-Rex-shaped Kelingking Beach to Broken Beach and Angel’s Billabong. End the day at Crystal Bay for a sunset to remember.

day9.title: Snorkel with Mantas & Diamond Views
day9.desc: Today’s highlight is a private snorkelling trip around Nusa Penida’s best bays, including the chance to swim with manta rays (conditions permitting). Then, head to the east of the island to snap views from Diamond Beach. Back at the hotel, enjoy a laid-back island night.

day10.title: Bikes & Beach Clean on Gili T
day10.desc: Catch a ferry to the car-free island of Gili T. Explore the island by bike and settle into your beachside hotel. In the evening, join a sunset beach clean-up with the Gili Eco Trust, then hit the beach bars or kick back with a movie under the stars.

day11.title: Swim with Turtles
day11.desc: Grab your fins and mask for a private boat trip around the Gilis. You’ll snorkel with sea turtles, explore vibrant coral reefs, and visit the iconic underwater statues. Spend the rest of the day swimming, sunbathing, or sipping something cold at a beach café. Tonight, celebrate island life however you like, from reggae bars to beach bonfires.

day12.title: Back to Bali & Goodbyes
day12.desc: After breakfast, we leave paradise behind and return to Bali by boat. You’ll get dropped off in Canggu by mid-afternoon, perfect for your next stop or flight out. It’s goodbye for now, but your Bali memories and new travel mates are here to stay.

seo_data.meta_title: 10 Day Small Group Tour in Cambodia | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: From ancient wonders to island sunsets, this trip has it all. Explore Angkor Wat, cruise through floating villages, snorkel in crystal-clear waters, and zip around in tuk tuks from Siem Reap to Koh Rong.

open_graph.title: 10 Day Group Tour in Cambodia with Angkor Wat, Beaches & Culture | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: From ancient wonders to island sunsets, this trip has it all. Explore Angkor Wat, cruise through floating villages, snorkel in crystal-clear waters, and zip around in tuk tuks from Siem Reap to Koh Rong. Culture, adventure, and beachside chills.

tour_information.description: From ancient wonders to island sunsets, this trip has it all. Explore Angkor Wat, cruise through floating villages, snorkel in crystal-clear waters, and zip around in tuk tuks from Siem Reap to Koh Rong.
activities_incl: Tuk Tuk Tour of Phnom Penh

day1.title: Welcome to Phnom Penh
day1.desc: Touchdown in buzzing Phnom Penh. We’ll meet you at the airport and head straight to the hotel, where you’ll link up with your travel crew and start getting hyped. Tonight, we’ll kick things off with dinner, drinks, and plenty of good vibes.

day2.title: Tuk Tuk Tour & Cambodian History
day2.desc: Start the day with a tuk tuk ride through the lively streets of Phnom Penh, soaking up the local energy and everyday life. Then, we’ll visit two powerful sites that shaped Cambodia’s history: the S21 Prison and the Killing Fields. Tonight, we’ll lighten the mood with dinner, drinks, and a night out in true Phnom Penh style.

day3.title: Kampot Kayak Adventure
day3.desc: We’re heading to Kampot today, a chilled countryside province known for its laid-back vibes. After checking into our riverside guesthouse, we’ll jump into kayaks and cruise along the calm waters, surrounded by lush greenery and peaceful views. Total zen mode.

day4.title: Pepper Plantation & Cooking Class
day4.desc: Kampot’s famous for its world-class pepper, and this morning we’re diving straight into it with a visit to a local plantation. After a tour of the grounds, it’s time to roll up your sleeves for a Cambodian cooking class. You’ll whip up some iconic dishes before wrapping up the day with a laid-back sunset cruise on the river.

day5.title: Island Time Begins
day5.desc: We’re off to island paradise. After a scenic train ride and ferry, we’ll arrive at the dreamy shores of Koh Rong Sanloem and check in to our stay, run by the local village chief. This afternoon is all about switching to island time—think beach hangs, cold beers, and golden hour views from the legendary Cliff Bar.

day6.title: Snorkelling Trip
day6.desc: This morning, we’re jumping on a private longtail boat to explore the island’s top snorkelling spots. Swim with tropical fish, kick back on hidden beaches, and soak up those laid-back island vibes. Sun, sea, and serious chill.

day7.title: Chill Out & Night Bus
day7.desc: Make the most of your final morning in island paradise with one last beach chill or ocean dip. Then we’ll ferry back to the mainland, grab some dinner, and hop on the overnight bus to Siem Reap. Rest up—more adventure awaits.

day8.title: Floating Village
day8.desc: We’ll arrive in Siem Reap bright and early, then head out to explore the countryside. Cruise through traditional floating villages, past rice fields, lotus ponds, and flooded forests. It’s a peaceful glimpse into rural Cambodian life.

day9.title: The Mighty Angkor Wat
day9.desc: We’ve saved a big one for last. Today, you’ll explore Angkor Wat—one of the 7 Ancient Wonders of the World and the largest religious monument on the planet. With a local guide leading the way, you’ll dive into the history, wander ancient temples, and even visit Ta Prohm, made famous by Tomb Raider. Tonight, it’s time to celebrate an epic trip with a final dinner and one last night out with the crew.

day10.title: Time to Say Goodbye
day10.desc: And just like that, your 10-day adventure comes to an end. If you're heading home, it's airport time. But if you’re not ready to say goodbye, why not keep the journey going? Stick around in Cambodia or explore more of Southeast Asia—your new travel fam and our team have got your back.

seo_data.meta_title: 18 Day Group Tour in Central America | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: From the beaches of Mexico to the jungles of Guatemala, this 18-day adventure packs in ancient ruins, vibrant culture, tropical islands, and volcanic treks.

open_graph.title: 18 Day Multi Country Adventure Tour in Central America with Culture & Beaches | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: From the beaches of Mexico to the jungles of Guatemala, this 18-day adventure packs in ancient ruins, vibrant culture, tropical islands, and volcanic treks.

tour_information.description: From the beaches of Mexico to the jungles of Guatemala, this 18-day adventure packs in ancient ruins, vibrant culture, tropical islands, and volcanic treks.
activities_incl: Sunset Boat Trip on Bacalar Lagoon

day1.title: Arrive in Playa del Carmen
day1.desc: Touch down in Cancun where we’ll be waiting to greet you with a warm welcome and transfer you to the lively beach town of Playa del Carmen. You’ll have time to check into the hotel, freshen up, and unwind before meeting the group and your guide. We’ll finish the day with a group dinner, where you’ll start bonding with your new travel crew.

day2.title: Chichén Itzá & Cenote Swim
day2.desc: We kick things off with a visit to one of the New Seven Wonders of the World—Chichén Itzá. With a local guide, we’ll dive into the history of this incredible site, exploring the towering Temple of Kukulkan, the sacred cenote, and the Temple of Warriors. Afterwards, we cool off with a refreshing dip in a stunning underground cenote before heading back to Playa for a chilled evening.

day3.title: Tulum Ruins & Beaches
day3.desc: It’s time for some beachside culture. We’ll head south to explore the famous cliffside ruins of Tulum, where Mayan temples overlook the turquoise Caribbean Sea. Spend the afternoon soaking up the sun, grabbing a bite in town, or taking a dip in the ocean before heading back to Playa for a night of tacos, tequila, and tropical vibes.

day4.title: Bacalar Sunset Boat Ride
day4.desc: Today we hit the road and head to Bacalar, known for its unreal lagoon with water so blue it’s called the “Lake of Seven Colours.” After checking into our hotel, we’ll hop aboard a boat and cruise across the lagoon at sunset. Grab a cold drink, take a swim, and enjoy the peaceful views.

day5.title: Cross into Belize
day5.desc: Country number two! We cross the border into Belize and hop on a ferry to the laid-back island of Caye Caulker. This place is all about good vibes—no cars, just bikes and golf carts, friendly locals, and that perfect mix of sun, sea, and sand. After checking in, we’ll toast the day with sunset drinks at The Split.

day6.title: Snorkelling the Belize Barrier Reef
day6.desc: Time to explore the world beneath the waves. We board a boat to Hol Chan Marine Reserve, part of the second-largest barrier reef in the world. Snorkel with rays, sea turtles, colourful fish, and even manatees if we’re lucky. Back on the island, we’ll feast on fresh seafood and Caribbean flavours.

day7.title: Caye Caulker Beach Day
day7.desc: Today is all yours. Lounge by the beach, float in the sea, sip cocktails at beach bars, or try out paddleboarding or more snorkelling. This is island life at its finest. No rush, no schedule—just you and paradise.

day8.title: Mayan Cooking
day8.desc: We say goodbye to Belize and head inland, stopping at a local Mayan village along the way. Roll up your sleeves for a traditional cooking class where you’ll learn how to make local dishes and enjoy lunch with the community. Then we continue to Flores, Guatemala, and settle into our lakeside hotel.

day9.title: Explore Tikal Ruins
day9.desc: Tikal is an absolute showstopper. Hidden in the jungle, this vast ancient city is filled with towering pyramids, ceremonial plazas, and temples. With our expert guide, we’ll uncover the secrets of this legendary site, climb the pyramids, and maybe even spot some howler monkeys in the trees.

day10.title: Candelaria Caves & Cobán
day10.desc: Today, we head south through the Guatemalan countryside. On the way, we stop at the sacred Candelaria Caves—an underground system that Mayans believed to be the entrance to the underworld. After exploring, we continue on to Cobán, a misty highland town surrounded by lush green hills.

day11.title: Semuc Champey
day11.desc: Adventure time. We hop into 4x4s and journey deep into the jungle to Semuc Champey, a hidden paradise of turquoise terraced pools. Spend the day swimming, hiking, and tubing down the river. Later, we visit a local Mayan home for a hearty home-cooked lunch.

day12.title: Chichicastenango & Lake Atitlán
day12.desc: We continue south through the highlands and stop at Chichicastenango—home to one of the biggest and most vibrant markets in Central America. After some exploring and souvenir hunting, we travel to the lakeside town of Panajachel, where we unwind with volcano views and peaceful lakeside vibes.

day13.title: San Marcos & San Juan Homestay
day13.desc: Today we hop on a boat to cross Lake Atitlán. First stop: San Marcos, a peaceful town known for yoga, nature, and chill. Later, we continue to San Juan where we’ll stay overnight with local Mayan families. Share stories, practise your Spanish, and experience life with our amazing hosts.

day14.title: Mayan Face Sunrise Hike
day14.desc: We wake up early and hike up Mayan Face Mountain, reaching the summit just in time for sunrise over the lake and surrounding volcanoes. After cocoa and breakfast, we say goodbye to our host families and travel to the stunning colonial town of Antigua.

day15.title: Antigua Free Day
day15.desc: You’ve earned it. Today is all yours to explore Antigua at your pace. Wander through cobblestone streets, sip coffee with a view, shop the artisan markets, or just kick back and take in the scenery. It’s chill time before our final adventure.

day16.title: Acatenango Volcano Trek
day16.desc: Lace up your boots, we’re climbing Acatenango! This epic overnight trek takes us above the clouds to camp with front-row views of the constantly erupting Fuego Volcano. It’s a challenging climb, but 100% worth it.

day17.title: Descend & Celebrate
day17.desc: After catching sunrise from the summit, we descend back to Antigua, where warm showers, tasty food, and a night of celebration await. Tonight, we toast to one incredible journey with a final group dinner and drinks.

day18.title: Onward Travel
day18.desc: Our adventure ends today, but your journey doesn’t have to. Whether you’re staying in Antigua, heading to the airport, or off to your next destination, we’re here to help with your plans. Big hugs, happy memories, and new friends for life.

seo_data.meta_title: 12 Day Small Group Tour in Colombia | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: This trip is pure Colombia magic. From Medellín to the Caribbean coast, we’re diving into vibrant cities, lush jungles, river tubing, and island hopping.

open_graph.title: 12 Day Adventure Group Tour in Colombia with Mountains, Cities & Beaches | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: This trip is pure Colombia magic. From Medellín to the Caribbean coast, we’re diving into vibrant cities, lush jungles, river tubing, and island hopping.

tour_information.description: This trip is pure Colombia magic. From Medellín to the Caribbean coast, we’re diving into vibrant cities, lush jungles, river tubing, and island hopping.

day1.title: Welcome to Medellín
day1.desc: ¡Bienvenidos! We’ll meet you at the airport and take you to the hotel to relax and settle in. Once you’ve shaken off the flight, meet your crew for a welcome dinner and drinks. Share travel stories, clink glasses, and toast to the start of your Colombian adventure. Let the good times roll.

day2.title: Guatapé and Coffee Farm
day2.desc: Fuel up on Colombian coffee, we’re heading to El Peñol Rock for a 650-step climb with unbeatable views over lakes and islands. After your workout, explore Colombia’s most colourful town, Guatapé, with its rainbow-painted streets and quirky houses. Later, visit a local coffee farm to learn the journey from bean to brew and sip some of the world’s best.

day3.title: Medellín City Tour
day3.desc: Today we explore Medellín’s incredible transformation. Visit Comuna 13, once one of the city’s most dangerous areas, now known for its street art, music, and community pride. Ride the metro cable for amazing views, stroll vibrant plazas, and finish the day with food, drinks, and maybe a little dancing. Medellín by night hits different.

day4.title: Fly to Santa Marta
day4.desc: We leave Medellín behind and fly to the Caribbean coast. After checking into our lively hostel, relax by the pool or head to the beach. Santa Marta is a hub for backpackers, so there’s always something happening. Grab a cold drink, meet new faces, and get ready for a night out under the stars.

day5.title: Minca Jungle Day
day5.desc: Escape into the Sierra Nevada mountains as we travel to Minca. Waterfalls, lush forest, and rich biodiversity await. Hike to hidden cascades, swim in cool jungle pools, and snap some shots of monkeys or toucans. We end the day at Sierra Mincacocktails, hammocks, and sweeping views guaranteed.

day6.title: Rio Buritaca
day6.desc: We’re going deeper into nature with a stay by the Rio Buritaca. Chill by the water, sip a cocktail at the river bar, or join a game of beach volleyball. At night, gather around the bonfire for drinks, stories, and a sky full of stars. There’s magic in the jungle air.

day7.title: River Tubing
day7.desc: Grab a float and your favourite drink and tube down the river through the jungle. Drift along with music playing and nothing but jungle on either side. As you reach the beach, the sunset lights up the horizon. It’s one of those moments you’ll never forget.

day8.title: Travel to Isla Grande
day8.desc: Pack up early for our journey to Isla Grande in the Rosario Islands. Our eco-hostel is tucked into the mangroves, surrounded by Caribbean beauty. Spend the afternoon swimming, sunbathing, or sipping fresh juice with ocean views. This is the definition of paradise.

day9.title: Caribbean Boat Tour
day9.desc: All aboard for a day of island hopping. Snorkel coral reefs, explore hidden bays, and dive into crystal-clear water. We’ll cruise across the Caribbean in style, making swim stops and sun-soaked memories. The soundtrack: waves, laughter, and your favourite playlist.

day10.title: Cartagena Old Town
day10.desc: We return to the mainland and head straight to Cartagena. Take a guided walking tour through the historic Old Town and colourful Getsemaní district. Snap photos, learn the stories behind the walls, and soak in the vibrant street life. Sunset drinks on the city walls? Absolutely.

day11.title: Final Fiesta in Cartagena
day11.desc: Spend your last day soaking up Cartagena’s vibes. Chill in a café, grab last-minute souvenirs, or watch the waves roll in. Then get ready for one last wild night on the Chiva party bus. Music, lights, dancingand Guaro shots, of course. End the trip the way it deserves: with a bang.

day12.title: Farewell from Colombia
day12.desc: Enjoy one last breakfast, hug it out with your crew, and get ready for whatever comes next. Your group leader is on hand to help with travel plans or just one more dance before heading home. Colombia, you’ve been unforgettable.

seo_data.meta_title: 13 Day Small Group Tour in Costa Rica | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: From rainforest treks to sun-soaked beaches, this 13-day Costa Rica adventure packs in volcano views, natural hot springs, vibrant wildlife, and laid-back surf towns.

open_graph.title: 13 Day Costa Rica Adventure Tour with Rainforests, Volcanoes & Beaches | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: From rainforest treks to sun-soaked beaches, this 13-day Costa Rica adventure packs in volcano views, natural hot springs, vibrant wildlife, and laid-back surf towns. With a mix of iconic spots and local secrets, you’ll dive into pura vida life with a crew of new mates and one epic group leader. Let’s go wild.

tour_information.description: From rainforest treks to sun-soaked beaches, this 13-day Costa Rica adventure packs in volcano views, natural hot springs, vibrant wildlife, and laid-back surf towns.
activities_incl: Rincon de la Viaja National Park Ticket

day1.title: Welcome to Costa Rica!
day1.desc: Hola and welcome to Costa Rica! As soon as you arrive in San José, we’ll pick you up from the airport and take you straight to your hotel. Settle in, relax, and breathe in that tropical air. In the evening, meet your group and guide for a chilled welcome evening to get to know each other and get hyped for the adventure ahead.

day2.title: San José City Tour
day2.desc: This morning we explore San José on foot, checking out the colourful markets, historical architecture, and local stories with our guide. Then we hit the road to La Fortuna, stopping at the famous Ox Cart Museum along the way. Keep your eyes peeled as Arenal Volcano comes into view; this epic natural giant watches over the vibrant jungle town of La Fortuna.

day3.title: Hanging Bridges & Volcones
day3.desc: Adventure calls as we venture into the rainforest, crossing breathtaking hanging bridges that weave through the jungle. Lush trails stretch ahead, offering a chance to spot some of Costa Rica’s most incredible wildlife and plant life. And if we’re lucky, we’ll catch a breathtaking view of Arenal Volcano. We’ll venture into the jungle after dark to discover its nocturnal wonders. But rest assured, we’ll be guided safely by an enthusiastic expert who will share fascinating local insights and secrets along the way

day4.title: Local Farm Experience & Hot Springs
day4.desc: Today we meet a local family who will show us around their farm. Pick tropical fruit, learn traditional farming methods, and enjoy a delicious home-cooked Costa Rican meal with coffee fresh from their land. In the afternoon, soak in the natural hot springs fed by the volcano. It's the perfect way to relax surrounded by jungle vibes.

day5.title: Maleku Culture & Río Celeste Hike
day5.desc: We start the day learning about the indigenous Maleku community, their traditions and language. Then it's off to Río Celeste, known for its electric-blue waters and lush rainforest trails. You’ll hike through the national park, passing bubbling rivers and waterfalls. By evening, we settle into our jungle lodge in Rincon de la Vieja.

day6.title: Rincon de la Vieja National Park Adventure
day6.desc: Lace up your boots, we’re trekking through volcanic landscapes, steam vents, and waterfalls in this wild and lesser-known park. Wildlife is everywhere if you look closely. In the afternoon, choose to relax at the lodge or fly through the canopy on a zipline adventure for those after an adrenaline hit.
activities_incl: Rincon de la Viaja National Park

day7.title: To the Beach: Hello Samara
day7.desc: We say goodbye to the mountains and make our way to the chill beach town of Samara. Once we arrive, the afternoon is yours. Think cocktails by the beach, beach volleyball, or just zoning out on a hammock. This is what pura vida is all about.

day8.title: Coastal Beach Day in Guanacaste
day8.desc: It’s time for a beach-hopping adventure along Guanacaste’s stunning coast. You’ll spend the day soaking up sun, swimming in crystal-clear waters, and exploring hidden coves. If you’re up for it, bring a football, a speaker, or just a towel and enjoy a full-on tropical beach day.

day9.title: Samara Free Day
day9.desc: Explore Samara your way! Surf lessons? Go for it. Chill beach time? Absolutely. Fancy a boat trip or kayak session? Just ask. Or take it super slow with a fresh coconut and your feet in the sand. Whatever vibe you want today, Samara delivers.

day10.title: Crocodile Bridge & Arrival in Esterillos
day10.desc: After a relaxed morning in Samara, we hit the road south. Along the way, we’ll stop at the famous Crocodile Bridge — yes, there are real crocs! Grab some lunch, enjoy the views, and by late afternoon, we arrive in laid-back Esterillos. Check into the hotel, kick back, and maybe catch the sunset from the beach.

day11.title: Manuel Antonio National Park
day11.desc: Today is one of the highlights! Head into the rainforest trails of Manuel Antonio National Park, spotting sloths, monkeys, and colourful birds. After our wildlife fix, chill out on the park’s beautiful beaches. It’s all white sand, jungle backdrops, and clear water, a total paradise.

day12.title: Travel to San José & Farewell Dinner
day12.desc: Leaving the coast behind, we head back to San José, where our journey began. On the way, we’ll make a stop at the Crocodile Bridge, offering a fantastic vantage point to observe these impressive prehistoric creatures. After checking back into the hotel, you'll have a final opportunity to explore any sights you missed during our first visit to San José. This evening, we’ll gather for a farewell meal and drinks, toasting to our unforgettable adventure in Costa Rica. Pura Vida!

day13.title: Onward Travel
day13.desc: After breakfast, it’s time to pack up and check out. Your guide will be on hand to help with any onward travel, whether you're heading to the airport or continuing your adventures through Central America. It’s been an epic journey full of waterfalls, jungles, beaches, and wildlife and of course, amazing new friends. We'll miss the pura vida vibes, but they’re now a part of you. Safe travels and see you on your next adventure!

seo_data.meta_title: 10 Day Croatia Sailing Small Group Tour | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: Sun-drenched days, medieval towns, and island-hopping bliss. This 10-day trip has it all. Sail the Adriatic on a premium boat, explore ancient cities, swim in hidden coves, and party by the sea.

open_graph.title: 10 Day Sailing Adventure Group Tour in Croatia with Islands & Beaches | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: Sun-drenched days, medieval towns, and island-hopping bliss. This 10-day trip has it all. Sail the Adriatic on a premium boat, explore ancient cities, swim in hidden coves, and party by the sea.

tour_information.description: Sun-drenched days, medieval towns, and island-hopping bliss. This 10-day trip has it all. Sail the Adriatic on a premium boat, explore ancient cities, swim in hidden coves, and party by the sea.
activities_incl: Swim stops in the Adriatic Sea
Hike up to the Spanish Fortress in Hvar
Entrance to Krka Waterfalls National Park

day1.title: Welcome to Croatia
day1.desc: Welcome to Croatia. After landing in Split, we’ll pick you up and take you to your hostel near the Old Town. Spend the afternoon settling in before meeting your group and guide. Tonight, we head out for dinner and drinks to get the good vibes going.

day2.title: Explore Split & Sail to Makarska
day2.desc: Start the morning with a walking tour through Split’s Roman ruins and buzzing markets. After lunch, it’s time to board your home for the week: a premium sailing boat with ensuite cabins and a sun deck. We cruise to Makarska with a swim stop on the way. Dock, explore the town, and grab a cocktail by the beach.
activities_incl: Swim stops in the Adriatic Sea

day3.title: Mljet National Park by Bike
day3.desc: After breakfast on deck, we sail to the lush island of Mljet. Stop for a swim in a secluded bay before docking at the park entrance. Hop on a bike and cycle around saltwater lakes and forest trails. In the evening, enjoy dinner with the crew and watch the sun set over the Adriatic.

day4.title: Discover Dubrovnik
day4.desc: Today we arrive in iconic Dubrovnik. Paddle around the city’s fortress walls on a kayak tour for the best views, then hit the cobbled streets on a guided walk through the Old Town. After dinner, we’ll check out the nightlife. One of the bars is inside a real medieval fortress.

day5.title: Sail & Unwind in Trstenik
day5.desc: We leave Dubrovnik and sail past olive groves and vineyards. Today is all about relaxing, swimming, and soaking up the scenery. In the evening, we dock in the quiet fishing village of Trstenik. Dress up a little for the Captain’s Dinner onboard with games and laughs under the stars.

day6.title: Cruise into Korcula
day6.desc: This morning’s sail brings us to Korcula, a charming island with red rooftops and narrow laneways. Explore the Old Town on a walking tour, then spend your afternoon shopping, eating, or sipping sunset cocktails by the sea.

day7.title: Live it up in Hvar
day7.desc: Another perfect day of sailing and swim stops ends in glamorous Hvar. Climb to the Spanish Fortress for epic views, explore the town, and enjoy a big night out. This is where superyachts meet medieval beauty and late-night parties.
activities_incl: Hike up to the Spanish Fortress in Hvar

day8.title: Final Sail into Split
day8.desc: It’s our last day onboard. We sail back to Split, taking in views of the coastline. After docking, enjoy a final walking tour, soak up the city’s buzz, and make the most of your last night by the water.

day9.title: Krka Waterfalls Adventure
day9.desc: We travel inland to Krka National Park to explore its incredible waterfalls and swimming spots. Walk the trails, dive into natural pools, and stop for lunch in the picturesque town of Skradin. Back in Split, we wrap things up with a farewell dinner.
activities_incl: Entrance to Krka Waterfalls National Park

day10.title: Farewell from Split
day10.desc: Say goodbye to your new travel fam and the boat life. Whether you’re flying home or travelling on, we’ll help with plans and send you off with tan lines and epic memories.

seo_data.meta_title: 13 Day Japan Small Group Tour | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: From Tokyo’s neon buzz to Kyoto’s hidden temples, this Japan adventure blends iconic sights with local secrets.

open_graph.title: 13 Day Japan Essentials Tour with Culture, Food & Adventure | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: From Tokyo’s neon buzz to Kyoto’s hidden temples, this Japan adventure blends iconic sights with local secrets.

tour_information.description: From Tokyo’s neon buzz to Kyoto’s hidden temples, this Japan adventure blends iconic sights with local secrets.
activities_incl: Visit to Senso-ji Temple at night

day1.title: Welcome to Japan!
day1.desc: Your adventure kicks off in Tokyo’s historic Asakusa district. After settling into your hostel, meet your guide and fellow travellers over a welcome feast packed with local flavours. As the sun sets, we’ll wander to the Senso-ji Temple, beautifully illuminated at night. It’s the perfect intro to Japan’s blend of tradition and modern magic.

day2.title: Tokyo Day Tour
day2.desc: Start the day with a Japan Orientation session, learning helpful phrases and customs. Then we hit Harajuku for street fashion and quirky culture, followed by the peaceful Meiji Shrine in Yoyogi Park. In the afternoon, neon lights take over as we explore Akihabara, the anime and gaming capital. Whether it’s maid cafés or go-karting in costume, this is Tokyo at its most electric.

day3.title: Shibuya Adventures
day3.desc: Enjoy a free morning in Tokyo to discover your own slice of the city, maybe sushi-making, a stroll through Ueno Park or a visit to the futuristic TeamLab. In the evening, we explore Shinjuku, visit Omoide Yokocho Alley for yakitori, and wrap up the night watching the iconic Shibuya crossing from above.

day4.title: Fuji Views & Mountain Life
day4.desc: Hop aboard the Romance Car bound for Hakone, a mountain town famed for hot springs and Fuji views. After checking into our cosy tatami guesthouse, we head deeper into the mountains for scenic walks and photo ops of Mt Fuji (weather depending). In the evening, we enjoy a traditional family-style dinner back at the guesthouse.

day5.title: Gion Geisha Walk
day5.desc: Say farewell to the mountains and board a bullet train to Kyoto, Japan’s cultural heart. After arriving and settling into our central hostel, we set out to explore Gion, home to lantern-lit alleyways and the iconic Geisha tradition. Dinner tonight is at a local favourite yakitori spot.

day6.title: Fushimi-Inari & Temple Trails
day6.desc: We’re up early to explore Fushimi Inari Shrine’s iconic red torii gates without the crowds. Then it’s on to Kiyomizu-dera Temple, perched above the city with incredible views. The afternoon is yours to dive deeper, maybe a kimono rental, traditional tea ceremony, or a walk through Nishiki Market.

day7.title: Bamboo Forest & Monkey Mountain
day7.desc: Today we take a scenic trip to Arashiyama. Wander through the whispering Bamboo Forest and hike Monkey Mountain for a view over Kyoto. Optional extras include a peaceful riverboat cruise or a visit to the Samurai and Ninja Museum. The rest of the day is yours to explore this charming riverside town.

day8.title: Golden Pavilion & Osaka Street Eats
day8.desc: We start with Kyoto’s famous Golden Pavilion and the tranquil Zen gardens of Daitoku-ji. In the afternoon, we journey to Osaka, Japan’s street food capital. Your guide leads you through the buzzing Dotonbori district to sample takoyaki, okonomiyaki and more. The night ends with karaoke and drinks in true Osaka style.

day9.title: Osaka Castle Gardens
day9.desc: Spend the morning exploring Osaka your way, maybe Spa World, the Ramen Museum or AmericaTown. In the afternoon, we visit Osaka Castle Gardens, then head to the nostalgic Shinsekai district for local eats and a colourful street scene. It’s a perfect balance of history and fun.

day10.title: Nara Park & Osaka Nightlife
day10.desc: We take a short train ride to Nara, a peaceful city filled with friendly roaming deer and ancient temples. Walk through the park, visit Todai-ji Temple, and soak up the serene vibes before returning to Osaka to explore more of its vibrant districts or opt for TeamLab Osaka.

day11.title: Hiroshima Reflections
day11.desc: A slower morning before we hop the train to Hiroshima. In the afternoon, a local guide walks us through the Peace Memorial Park, telling the stories behind the Atomic Dome and eternal flame. A moving and important experience that brings deeper meaning to your journey.

day12.title: Miyajima Island & Coastal Serenity
day12.desc: Today we ferry over to Miyajima Island, home of the floating torii gate. Wander peaceful paths to shrines and temples, spot deer in the wild, and explore the Hall of 1,000 Mats. Optional traditional archery is available, or just soak in the coastal serenity. We return for a final group dinner and night out.

day13.title: Until Next Time, Japan
day13.desc: It’s time to say goodbye to your travel crew and an unforgettable trip. Whether you’re heading home or continuing your adventures, we’ll make sure you’ve got the support you need. Until next time.

seo_data.meta_title: 12 Day Small Group Tour in Mexico | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: Explore the best of Mexico in 14 unforgettable days! From buzzing Mexico City to Mayan ruins, colourful towns, tropical islands, and beach paradise, this trip is packed with culture, adventure, and fun.

open_graph.title: 12 Day Group Tour in Mexico with Culture, Ruins & Beach Adventures | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: Explore the best of Mexico in 14 unforgettable days! From buzzing Mexico City to Mayan ruins, colourful towns, tropical islands, and beach paradise, this trip is packed with culture, adventure, and fun.

tour_information.description: Explore the best of Mexico in 14 unforgettable days! From buzzing Mexico City to Mayan ruins, colourful towns, tropical islands, and beach paradise, this trip is packed with culture, adventure, and fun.
activities_incl: Oaxaca & San Cristobal de las Casas
Island Boat Tour of Isla Holbox

day1.title: Arrive in Mexico City
day1.desc: Touch down in Mexico’s bustling capital! We’ll meet you at the airport and take you straight to our central hotel. You’ll have time to chill out, unpack, and freshen up before meeting your guide and group for a welcome chat. The evening is all about getting to know each other and settling into the vibrant vibe of Mexico.

day2.title: Discover Mexico City
day2.desc: Today we explore the heart of one of the world’s most exciting cities. Wander through the historic centre on a guided tour and uncover layers of history, from ancient Aztec ruins to colonial landmarks. Check out the Zocalo, Metropolitan Cathedral, and more. This afternoon is yours—relax, explore, or visit a local museum. Tonight, we regroup for a traditional Mexican dinner and live music show.

day3.title: Puebla & Oaxaca
day3.desc: We leave Mexico City and make a scenic stop in Puebla, known as a ‘Magical Town’. With volcano views and colourful colonial buildings, it’s the perfect lunch spot. Then we continue to Oaxaca, where we’ll check into our hotel and head out to experience the buzzing streets by night—think mezcal bars, street tacos, and music-filled plazas.

day4.title: Explore Oaxaca
day4.desc: Wake up and get ready to dive into Oaxaca’s cultural soul. Wander through traditional markets bursting with colours, smells, and flavours, visit stunning cathedrals, and soak up the unique atmosphere. The afternoon is yours to relax, shop, or people-watch from a plaza café. In the evening, we’ll gather for more delicious Oaxacan food and maybe a cheeky mezcal.
activities_incl: Oaxaca & San Cristobal de las Casas

day5.title: Mezcal & Tehuantepec
day5.desc: Enjoy a chilled morning before heading into the valleys to visit a local family and learn how handmade textiles are woven using age-old techniques. We then visit a traditional mezcal distillery to learn how this smoky spirit is made—and of course, try a few samples. Afterward, we drive to Tehuantepec where we stay the night en route to Chiapas.

day6.title: Canyon Cruise & San Cristobal
day6.desc: Today we hit the water on a boat tour through the epic Sumidero Canyon. Glide between towering cliffs, spot wildlife, and soak up the jungle vibes. Then it’s off to the highlands as we travel to the colourful colonial town of San Cristobal de las Casas. After checking in, we’ll take a short orientation walk and enjoy a relaxed evening in this mountain gem.

day7.title: Indigenous Culture & Local Life
day7.desc: We spend today connecting with the roots of Chiapas. First, we visit Zinacantán and San Juan Chamula, two Indigenous towns with strong cultural traditions and unique churches. You’ll learn about local customs and see a very different side of Mexico. Back in San Cristobal, enjoy free time for shopping, trying local coffee or Pox (a traditional liquor), or joining an optional pottery class. In the evening, we’ll enjoy a group dinner.

day8.title: Fly to Cancun
day8.desc: We say goodbye to the mountains and hop on a short flight to sunny Cancun. On arrival, we head to our hotel and get a taste of the Caribbean coast. The afternoon is yours to explore or relax before we head out for some chilled dinner and optional drinks.

day9.title: Ferry to Isla Holbox
day9.desc: Get ready for paradise. We catch a ferry to Isla Holbox, a dreamy island with white sand, turquoise waters, and a laid-back feel. After checking in, grab a fresh ceviche, swing in a hammock, and toast the sunset with beachside tunes and tropical cocktails.

day10.title: Isla Holbox Boat Tour
day10.desc: Today we hit the water for a boat tour around Isla Holbox. Search for pink flamingos, visit quiet island spots, and take a dip in a beautiful cenote. After returning to shore, enjoy some chill time—read a book, nap in a hammock, or stroll the colourful streets. In the evening, we’ll meet up for a group beach BBQ with food, drinks, and music under the stars.
activities_incl: Island Boat Tour of Isla Holbox

day11.title: Travel to Playa del Carmen
day11.desc: Today we ferry back to the mainland and head down the coast to Playa del Carmen, a lively beach town known for its great food, nightlife, and palm-lined beaches. After checking into our hotel, you'll have the afternoon free to explore, relax on the beach, or dive into some shopping. In the evening, we’ll head out to explore Playa’s buzzing bar and restaurant scene.

day12.title: Chichén Itzá & Cenote Swim
day12.desc: This morning we set off on a day trip to Chichén Itzá, one of the New Seven Wonders of the World. With our local guide, we’ll uncover the history and secrets of this incredible Mayan site. Afterwards, we cool off with a swim in a crystal-clear underground cenote—one of Mexico’s natural wonders. Return to Playa for a chilled evening.

day13.title: Tulum Ruins & Beaches
day13.desc: Today’s about ancient ruins and beach vibes. We visit the famous Tulum Ruins, perched on a cliff overlooking the Caribbean Sea. Then, relax on Tulum’s stunning beaches or take a dip in the turquoise water. Back in Playa del Carmen, we celebrate our final night with a farewell dinner and drinks with the crew.

day14.title: Check Out & Onward Travel
day14.desc: Our adventure wraps up today, but your Mexico story doesn’t have to end here. Whether you’re staying on in Playa or exploring more of Mexico, we’ll help with your onward travel plans. Hasta luego!

seo_data.meta_title: 17 Day New Zealand Small Group Tour | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: This 17-day trip has it all, glowworm caves, Hobbiton, hot springs, epic hikes, fjords, and wild jet boat rides. Explore from Auckland to Queenstown with an expert guide and a crew of new mates.

open_graph.title: 17 Day Adventure Group Tour in New Zealand with Culture & Landscapes | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: This 17-day trip has it all, glowworm caves, Hobbiton, hot springs, epic hikes, fjords, and wild jet boat rides. Explore from Auckland to Queenstown with an expert guide and a crew of new mates.

tour_information.description: This 17-day trip has it all, glowworm caves, Hobbiton, hot springs, epic hikes, fjords, and wild jet boat rides. Explore from Auckland to Queenstown with an expert guide and a crew of new mates.

day1.title: Welcome to Auckland
day1.desc: Touch down in the City of Sails and head straight to your central hostel. Once you’ve settled in, you’ll meet your guide and the rest of the group. In the evening, we’ll head out for a welcome dinner, perfect for breaking the ice and kicking off the trip in style.

day2.title: Glowworm Caves & Hobbiton
day2.desc: We head south from Auckland to the magical glowworm caves of Waitomo. Take a boat ride through illuminated underground caves, then continue to Hobbiton for a guided tour of the iconic film set. Walk through the Shire, visit the Green Dragon Inn, and take in the magic before heading to Rotorua.

day3.title: Geothermal Wonders
day3.desc: We begin the day at Kerosene Creek, a natural hot spring perfect for a relaxing soak. Then it’s off to Wai-O-Tapu, a colourful and otherworldly geothermal wonderland filled with boiling mud, geysers, and sulphur pools. The evening is yours to explore Rotorua or rest up.

day4.title: Māori Culture Experience
day4.desc: Use the morning to try Rotorua’s adrenaline-fuelled adventures like zorbing or the skyline luge. In the evening, immerse yourself in Māori culture at Mitai Village. Enjoy traditional performances, learn the haka, and share a hangi meal cooked in the earth.

day5.title: Travel to Taupo & Lake Sailing
day5.desc: Journey to Lake Taupo, the largest lake in New Zealand. In the afternoon, hop aboard a sailing boat and cruise across the calm waters, past scenic bays and the famous Māori rock carvings. Sunset views from the deck top off a perfect day.

day6.title: Waterfalls & Adrenaline
day6.desc: Today kicks off with a visit to Huka Falls, where powerful torrents rush through a narrow gorge in a roar of mist. Afterwards, the day is yours—go skydiving over Lake Taupo, take on a water-touch bungee, or chill lakeside with incredible views and good company.

day7.title: Head to Wellington
day7.desc: We travel through the central North Island to reach New Zealand’s capital. With its artsy vibes and scenic waterfront, Wellington is a perfect stop. After checking into our hostel, explore the city’s nightlife, visit quirky shops, or relax in a cosy café.

day8.title: Discover Wellington
day8.desc: Start your day with a guided orientation of Wellington’s best spots, from panoramic cable car views to street art-lined laneways. We then visit Te Papa, the national museum, to discover everything from Māori culture to Kiwi wildlife. Wrap up the day with dinner by the harbour.

day9.title: Fly to Christchurch
day9.desc: Say goodbye to the North Island as we board a short domestic flight to Christchurch. After landing, get to know this creative city built on resilience. Wander pop-up container malls, check out murals, and grab dinner at a local eatery.

day10.title: Christchurch to Lake Tekapo
day10.desc: We leave the city behind for one of NZ’s dreamiest locations. After passing through the Canterbury Plains, we arrive in Lake Tekapo, where snowy peaks reflect in crystal-clear waters. Visit the iconic Church of the Good Shepherd, then settle in for a peaceful night beneath star-filled skies.

day11.title: Mount John Hike
day11.desc: This morning, hike up Mount John for sweeping views across the Southern Alps and Lake Tekapo’s surreal turquoise water. In the afternoon, unwind with a soak in the hot pools nestled beside the lake. A perfect day to relax and recharge.

day12.title: Mount Cook National Park
day12.desc: Drive deeper into the Southern Alps to Aoraki Mount Cook, New Zealand’s highest peak. We’ll take the Hooker Valley Track through alpine landscapes, over swing bridges, and past glacial rivers to views of icebergs floating beneath snowcapped peaks.

day13.title: Explore Wanaka
day13.desc: Today we head to Wanaka, a picturesque lake town. We start with a kayak adventure across the lake and a visit to the famous Wanaka Tree. Later, we hike Mount Iron for views over the Clutha Valley and the Pisa Range. Chill out lakeside in the evening with drinks and mountain views.

day14.title: Arrive in Queenstown
day14.desc: We roll into Queenstown, New Zealand’s adventure capital. Settle into our base, walk the lakefront promenade, and sample the town’s famous food scene. If you’re on the work add-on, we’ll help you get sorted with job advice, bank details, and more.

day15.title: Milford Sound Cruise
day15.desc: Today we head to Fiordland for one of the most iconic experiences in NZ. Cruise through the towering cliffs and waterfalls of Milford Sound, watching for dolphins, penguins, and seals. It’s a day you’ll remember for years.

day16.title: Jet Boating & Farewell Dinner
day16.desc: Get your adrenaline fix as we zip through canyons and over river rapids on a thrilling jet boat ride through Lake Wakatipu’s backcountry. In the evening, join your crew for a final dinner to toast to friendships made and memories shared.

day17.title: Check Out
day17.desc: After breakfast, it’s time to say goodbye. Whether you're heading home or continuing your travels in New Zealand, we’re here to help you with plans, farewells, and next steps. The adventure may end, but the memories are just beginning.

seo_data.meta_title: 10 Day Small Group Tour in Peru | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: Peru is a classic. From colourful markets in Cuzco to the mighty Machu Picchu, it's a dream trip for nature lovers and culture seekers.

open_graph.title: 10 Day Peru Group Tour with Machu Picchu, Andes & Adventure | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: Peru is a classic. From colourful markets in Cuzco to the mighty Machu Picchu, it's a dream trip for nature lovers and culture seekers.

tour_information.description: Peru is a classic. From colourful markets in Cuzco to the mighty Machu Picchu, it's a dream trip for nature lovers and culture seekers.
activities_incl: Mountain Biking in the Sacred Valley

day1.title: Welcome to Peru!
day1.desc: Welcome to Peru! After checking into your hotel, it’s time to relax and settle in. In the evening, meet your travel group crew over some epic local dishes like quinoa soup or pollo a la brasa. Then it’s time to explore Cusco by nightgrab a beer and let the adventure begin!

day2.title: Cusco City & Ancient Sites
day2.desc: We start the day with an orientation walk to dive into Cusco’s rich culture and history. Wander colourful local markets, try new foods, and marvel at the fusion of Inca and Spanish architecture. The afternoon is yours to explore or relaxmaybe check out Sacsayhuamán or a local café. As night falls, we head out again. Pisco sour, anyone?

day3.title: Weaving and Pottery
day3.desc: Today is all about supporting local communities. Visit a rural village to learn the traditional techniques of weaving, spinning, and dyeing wool. Then we roll up our sleeves at a pottery school and get creative painting our own keepsake. Culture, art, and epic vibesthis day has it all.

day4.title: Salt Mines & Downhill Rides
day4.desc: En route to Ollantaytambo, we stop at the epic Maras Salt Mines. Learn about ancient salt mining traditions and snap some stunning shots. Then the real adrenaline kicks inmountain biking through the Andes with 360° views. We finish the day in the Sacred Valley, checking into our hotel in peaceful Ollantaytambo.

day5.title: Sacred Valley Explorer
day5.desc: Wake up to mountain views and birdsong. After breakfast, we head on a warm-up walk to a local viewpoint surrounded by ancient ruins and greenery. The rest of the day is freevisit the Inca archaeological site, take a cooking class, or chill before tomorrow’s big trek.

day6.title: The Inca Trail Begins
day6.desc: It’s Inca Trail day! Board the train to KM 104 and begin your one-day trek towards the Lost City. The trail follows the Urubamba River and passes stunning mountain and jungle scenery. By evening, you’ll have reached Aguas Calientes. Tomorrow: Machu Picchu.

day7.title: Machu Picchu Wonders
day7.desc: The big one. We head up to Machu Picchu early to beat the crowds. Take a guided tour through the ancient citadel, soaking up the views and history. Snap those Insta shots, explore hidden corners, and then head back to Cusco for a well-earned rest.

day8.title: Flavours of Peru
day8.desc: Take the morning slowgrab a coffee, wander the city, or just relax. This afternoon we sharpen our knives for a hands-on Peruvian cooking class. Learn to make local favourites like lomo saltado and whip up a proper pisco sour. Then we head out for one final big night!

day9.title: Rainbow Mountain Adventure
day9.desc: It’s an early start but worth every minute. After a drive, we trek up to the famous Rainbow Mountain, or Montaña de 7 Colores. At over 5000 metres, the views are unreal. Think layers of colour, crisp mountain air, and one of the best photo ops in the Andes.

day10.title: Farewell from Cusco
day10.desc: Enjoy a relaxed breakfast and take in one last look at the colourful streets and mountain views of Cusco. Swap photos and stories with your travel group before checking out. Whether you're heading home or continuing your journey, we’re here to help with anything you need. It’s been unforgettable. Stay curious and keep exploring.

seo_data.meta_title: 12 Day Group Tour in South Africa | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: Experience safaris, Zulu culture, epic hikes, and Cape Town sunsets on this 12-day South Africa tour packed with adventure and unforgettable moments.

open_graph.title: 12 Day Safari & Adventure Group Tour in South Africa with Wildlife & Culture | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: Experience safaris, Zulu culture, epic hikes, and Cape Town sunsets on this 12-day South Africa tour packed with adventure and unforgettable moments.

tour_information.description: Experience safaris, Zulu culture, epic hikes, and Cape Town sunsets on this 12-day South Africa tour packed with adventure and unforgettable moments.
activities_incl: Open Vehicle Drive of Kruger National Park
Cape of Good Hope Nature Reserve

day1.title: Arrive in Johannesburg
day1.desc: Welcome to South Africa! After touching down in Johannesburg, we’ll transfer you to our comfortable hotel where you can settle in and recover from the journey. Spend the afternoon at your own pace, then meet your group and guide in the evening for introductions, a welcome briefing, and your first dinner together.

day2.title: Explore Johannesburg & Soweto
day2.desc: Today we dive into South Africa’s vibrant culture and complex past. Visit Soweto township—home to political history, powerful art, and local flavour. We’ll explore landmarks such as the Apartheid Museum or Mandela’s House (depending on availability). In the evening, experience Soweto nightlife with drinks at some of the best local spots.

day3.title: Panorama Route to Graskop
day3.desc: After breakfast, we leave the city and head east toward the wild heart of Africa. We’ll journey along the breathtaking Panorama Route, stopping at dramatic viewpoints, waterfalls, and canyons. Expect stunning scenery at places like God’s Window and Blyde River Canyon before arriving in the mountain town of Graskop, where we’ll check in to our cozy lodge.

day4.title: Into the Wild: Kruger National Park
day4.desc: Today we head deep into the bush as we make our way to Kruger National Park, one of the best wildlife reserves in the world. Keep your eyes peeled for elephants, giraffes, zebras, and more on the drive in. Tonight we stay in pre-erected safari tents and enjoy a traditional Potjie—a South African stew cooked over an open fire—under the stars.

day5.title: Kruger Safari Game Drive
day5.desc: It’s safari time! Hop into an open-air game vehicle for a full-day wildlife experience in Kruger. With help from expert guides, we’ll search for Africa’s famous Big Five: lions, leopards, elephants, rhinos, and buffalo. This is one of those unforgettable days. Back at camp, we’ll gather around the fire for a braai (South African BBQ) and stargazing.
activities_incl: Open Vehicle Drive of Kruger National Park

day6.title: Cross into Eswatini
day6.desc: We leave South Africa and head into the Kingdom of Eswatini, where traditional ways of life still thrive. Arriving at Hlane Royal National Park, we’ll head out for a sunset game drive through the grasslands. Tonight, enjoy local food and, if we’re lucky, a performance of traditional Swazi singing by local rangers.

day7.title: Zulu Culture & Campfire Vibes
day7.desc: Re-entering South Africa, we journey south to Zululand, passing through dramatic landscapes. Here we’ll visit a local village and experience a powerful introduction to traditional Zulu life. Visit a local crèche, witness cultural dances, and connect with the community. In the evening, we relax with another tasty braai and share stories by the campfire.

day8.title: Head to the Coast
day8.desc: This morning, we visit another Zulu village before making our way to the Indian Ocean coastline. After checking in to our laid-back beach lodge in Blythedale, the rest of the day is yours to enjoy—chill on the sand, float in the pool, or catch up on some rest. Tonight, we try Bunny Chow, a Durban street food classic: spicy curry stuffed into a hollowed-out loaf of bread.

day9.title: Fly to Cape Town & Table Mountain
day9.desc: Today we hop on a short flight to Cape Town—South Africa’s most iconic city. With mountains, beaches, and world-class food, it’s a traveller’s dream. In the afternoon, we’ll head up Table Mountain (weather permitting) for panoramic views over the city. Later, stroll the V&A Waterfront for food, shopping, and ocean views.

day10.title: Cape Town City & Culture
day10.desc: Today is all about discovering the heart of Cape Town. On a guided walking tour, we’ll explore the city’s colourful streets, markets, and history. Learn about the stories that shaped this multicultural hub. Spend the afternoon checking out local galleries, grabbing lunch in a trendy cafe, or hitting the beach.

day11.title: Cape Peninsula Road Trip
day11.desc: Time for an epic road trip along the Cape Peninsula. We’ll stop at the Cape of Good Hope Nature Reserve, take a boat ride to Seal Island, and visit Boulders Beach to meet the famous African penguins. With sweeping coastal views and unforgettable wildlife, this day is a highlight of the trip.
activities_incl: Cape of Good Hope Nature Reserve

day12.title: Farewell or Onward Travel
day12.desc: Your South African adventure wraps up today. Say goodbye to your travel crew or continue exploring—Cape Town is full of options. Whether you're heading home or travelling onward, we’re here to help you plan the next leg of your journey.

seo_data.meta_title: 15 Day Small Group Tour in Sri Lanka | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: Explore Sri Lanka on our 20-45's Group Tour. Designed for solo travellers and young adults, it includes 28 activities, comfy accommodations, and authentic cuisine. Exceptional value awaits.

open_graph.title: 15 Day Adventure Group Tour in Sri Lanka with Safari, Beaches & Culture | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: Explore Sri Lanka on our 20-45's Group Tour. Designed for solo travellers and young adults, relish over 30 activities, comfy accommodations, and authentic cuisine. Exceptional value awaits.

tour_information.description: Explore Sri Lanka on our 20-45's Group Tour. Designed for solo travellers and young adults, it includes 28 activities, comfy accommodations, and authentic cuisine. Exceptional value awaits.
activities_incl: Boat Ride On the Lake with Sirigiya Rock View

day1.title: Welcome Dinner
day1.desc: Your Sri Lanka trip begins! Settle in at the hotel, meet your tour guides, and get to know your travel mates before a complimentary welcoming dinner of Sri Lankan delights. Then, a night out in the capital of Colombo.

day2.title: World Heritage sites of Negombo
day2.desc: Breakfast is included and then we're off to the Sri Lankan countryside! En route to Dambulla, we make a stop off at the lesser-known Elephant Rock for the first of many epic viewpoints. Then, check-in at the hotel before sunset explorations of the World Heritage Dambulla Cave - also known as the Golden Temple of Dambulla. Scientists have dated remains found here back to the 1st century BCE!

day3.title: Let's Go To Sirigiya Rock!
day3.desc: Sirigiya Rock - also known as Lion Rock - is likely the most famous and well-known site in all of Sri Lanka! There once stood a sprawling palace and fortress at the summit, then a Buddhist monastery. Oh, and the summit towers 200 metres high. Today, we wind our way up the stairs to soak in the epic views and learn about the history of this ancient UNESCO World Heritage Site. The final trip of the day is at sunset -adjacent to Sirigiya Rock is Pidurangala Rock and a quick 25-minute walk to the summit provides some seriously breathtaking views... and photos!

day4.title: Exclusive Village Tour
day4.desc: We've prepared for you a unique experience in the local village of Sigiriya. Take a walk through the rustic rural community, experience conventional rice fields, vegetable farming, cultivation of native yams and other crops, poultry keeping, and much more. You're sure to be hungry by this point, so we have an authentic Sri Lankan curry with rice and roti too. At the end of the trip, you would have experienced true Sri Lankan hospitality immersed with warmth and genuine smiles.

day5.title: Free Time in Kandy City
day5.desc: Catch the sunrise over Kandy Lake (if you so please)! Today is a dedicated day for you to rest and do as you want. Kandy is a vibrant city, boasting a lively nightlife scene, bars clubs and endless restaurants for you to explore.

day6.title: Famous Train Ride To Ella & Tea Plantation
day6.desc: Let's go trekking! Start the day wandering through some of the most picturesque tea plantations of Sri Lanka, known as Little Adam's Peak. At the summit, you will be greeted but a dramatic 360-degree view that is straight out of a postcard. After today's trek, your specialised local guide for the afternoon will break down the entire tea production process from seedlings to that delicious cuppa that we love oh so much. Then some time to explore the lovely mountain town of Ella.

day7.title: Cooking Class & Little Adams Peak
day7.desc: Cooking lessons are the best lessons! Now that your appetite is ready for a feast, we're off for a full-on Sri Lankan cooking class given by a welcoming family in their own home. A home tucked away in the mountains surrounding Ella and that provide some jaw-dropping views for the morning. After the cooking lesson and lunch, a quick walk to 9-Arch Bridge for one of the most famous viewpoints in all of Sri Lanka. By this point you will agree, it's hard to find a bad view in this country.

day8.title: Breathtaking Diyaluma Waterfalls
day8.desc: Diyaluma Falls soars 220 m (720 ft) high and is the second-highest waterfall in Sri Lanka. This makes for the perfect stop off as we head south from Ella to Udawalawe National Park. The trek to the top winds up to a big view and pools perfect for a cool-off dip. You can also take the plunge with a cliff jump into the many pools scattered here. Did we mention the views are epic? Then off for a night in Udalawalwe National Park.

day9.title: Jeep Safari & Beach!
day9.desc: Early pick-up from the specialised jeeps for the morning safari! This will likely be a top highlight of your Sri Lanka tour. A park guide will join each jeep to explain what you see, the history of the park, and to provide their years of insight into the many herds of elephants who call Udawalawe National Park home. You can expect to see wild herds of elephants - and also crocodiles, toque monkeys, water buffalo, Sambur deer, many bird species, and more. After an epic safari, we head to the coast and the coast of Weligama, a major tourist attraction of Sri Lanka known for its beach and corals.

day10.title: Surf Lesson & Beach Day!
day10.desc: Weligama Beach offers the ideal conditions for a surf lesson with soft, sandy bottoms, moderate swell, and great views. This is just a short skip up the coast and this is where you will spend the afternoon learning how to get up on that surfboard! The groups are broken down into small groups and this is definitely appropriate for first-timer surfers. After the surf lesson, we're off to the famous Coconut Hill for an epic sunset over Mirissa Beach. Sri Lanka sunsets never disappoint!

day11.title: Turtle Beach & Coconut Hill
day11.desc: Soak up the sun by the pool, or check out the stunning beaches right next to your hotel! In the afternoon, we will visit turtle beach followed by sunset at the famous coconut hill.

day12.title: Cycle Tour & Free Time
day12.desc: Morning cycle tour to see why Unawatuna is Sri Lanka's best-kept secret adventure spot! Our local guides lead a winding route through the stunning tea plantations and along the dramatic coastline. Learn about the local way of life from the locals themselves, no better way. After, chill at the hotel pool, grab a beach cabana on Unawatuna Beach, and we must say the seafood here is top-notch. Treat yourself, you're on holiday! Another sunset on Unawatuna is a great option but you can elect to do as you please with the rest of this day.

day13.title: Magnificent Galle Dutch Fort
day13.desc: Galle has been a bustling port town dating back to 125–150 AD when local Sinhalese merchants traded here with the Ancient Greeks. Galle Fort, in the Bay of Galle on the southwest coast of Sri Lanka, was built first in 1588 by the Portuguese. Then the Dutch took control and heavily fortified the fort during the 17th century. Sri Lanka has invested heavily to retain the integrity of the original buildings and fort structure where today we explore, and check out the famous lighthouse.

day14.title: Tsunami Museum & Farewell Dinner
day14.desc: Soak in some morning rays on the beach, this is the last beach day and the final full day of the tour.. we're not crying, you're crying! Before we head to Colombo, we stop by the Honganji Vihara Tsunami Monument and Tsunami Photo Museum to learn about the devastating effects of the 2004 tsunami. The local communities here and spread throughout the country are still recovering to this day. Your entry ticket (included) to the photo museum supports the reconstruction of the local volunteers who manage the museum. Then off to Colombo for a farewell feast (also included) and a final evening with your travel mates.

day15.title: Goodbye (For Now!)
day15.desc: Sri Lanka tour complete! Enjoy a final breakfast together and say your farewells and 'until-next-times' before catching your airport transfer (included) and flight home - or heading off to continue your travels. You've covered some serious ground over the last 15 days. If all goes to plan, this incredible country and everyone you met along the way will stick with you for a lifetime.

seo_data.meta_title: 12 Day Small Group Tour in Sri Lanka | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: From ancient temples to misty tea fields, wildlife safaris to golden beaches, this 12-day Sri Lanka tour is packed with adventure, culture and chill time.

open_graph.title: 12 Day Adventure Group Tour in Sri Lanka with Safari, Beaches & Culture | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: From ancient temples to misty tea fields, wildlife safaris to golden beaches, this 12-day Sri Lanka tour is packed with adventure, culture and chill time. You’ll hike famous peaks, ride the iconic Ella train, explore sacred sites, and unwind on the coast. Whether it’s your first trip to South Asia or your latest tropical escape, Sri Lanka will steal your heart.

tour_information.description: From ancient temples to misty tea fields, wildlife safaris to golden beaches, this 12-day Sri Lanka tour is packed with adventure, culture and chill time.

day1.title: Welcome to Sri Lanka
day1.desc: Touch down in Colombo anytime on Day 1 and we’ve got you covered. A friendly face from our team will meet you at the airport and transfer you to your hotel. In the evening, join your fellow travellers for a Sri Lankan welcome meal, your first taste of the island’s amazing cuisine and the perfect start to your journey.

day2.title: Dambulla Temples & Sunset Hike
day2.desc: Today the journey really begins. We drive to Dambulla and visit the famous Dambulla Cave Temple to marvel at ancient carvings and statues. Then we stop for lunch before checking into our hotel. In the afternoon, we head to Pidurangala Buddhist Monastery for incredible panoramic views of Sigiriya at sunset.

day3.title: Sigiriya Rock Climb
day3.desc: Start the morning by climbing Sigiriya, known as the eighth wonder of the world. It’s a steep hike, but the views from the top are unbeatable. Later, enjoy a traditional Sri Lankan lunch with a local family. The afternoon is free to relax by the pool, book a massage or opt for an elephant safari.

day4.title: Cooking & Temple Tour
day4.desc: We journey into the Knuckle Mountain Range, stopping at a spice garden to learn about local ingredients. Then roll up your sleeves for a hands-on Sri Lankan cooking class. In the afternoon, explore Kandy by tuk tuk before visiting the sacred Temple of the Tooth.

day5.title: Tea & Train Journey
day5.desc: This morning we tour a tea estate, picking and tasting some of the world’s finest Ceylon tea. After lunch, hop on the famous train from Nuwara Eliya to Ella, often rated as one of the most beautiful train journeys in the world.

day6.title: Free Day in Ella
day6.desc: Today is all yours. Hike to Ella Rock or Diyaluma Falls, stretch out in a yoga class, treat yourself to a massage or just relax poolside. Ella is laid-back and beautiful, so take it at your own pace.

day7.title: Peaks & Safari
day7.desc: We start the day hiking Little Adam’s Peak and visiting the world-famous Nine Arch Bridge. Then we travel to Udawalawe for an unforgettable elephant safari. Bring an overnight bag for this jungle stay.

day8.title: South to Mirissa
day8.desc: Wake up to jungle sounds before heading south to Mirissa. This chilled beach town is perfect for an afternoon swim, some beach lounging or renting a surfboard. End the day watching sunset from Coconut Tree Hill.

day9.title: Beach Day in Mirissa
day9.desc: You’ve got the full day to do whatever you fancy. Go whale watching if the season is right, join a surf lesson, or unwind with a massage. Prefer a slower pace? Lounge on the beach with a fresh coconut and enjoy the sunshine. Whether you're feeling active or laid-back, today is yours to enjoy however you like.

day10.title: Galle Ride & Fort Walk
day10.desc: Cycle through the countryside and past rice paddies, stopping to visit a local school. Then head into Galle to explore its historic Dutch Fort and browse shops and cafes. Relax for the rest of the day or enjoy the beach.

day11.title: Mangroves & Colombo
day11.desc: Spend a relaxed morning on the beach before visiting the 2004 Tsunami Memorial. Afterward, cruise through the mangrove forests of Madu River where you might spot birds and fishing villages along the way. We then continue to Colombo for our final night together.

day12.title: Final Goodbyes
day12.desc: After one final breakfast together, it’s time to say goodbye. Check out and head off for your flight or continue your travels. If you need help arranging anything, your guide will be there to support you. Thanks for making unforgettable memories with us in Sri Lanka.

seo_data.meta_title: 19 Day Group Tour in Thailand | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: Join our 19-day Thailand group tour. Perfect for solo travelers aged 20-45. Explore Bangkok, Phuket, Krabi, Koh Phi Phi. Adventure, culture, nightlife, expert guides. Book now!

open_graph.title: 19 Day Small Group Adventure Tour in Thailand with Temples, Islands & Culture | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: Join our 19-day Thailand group tour. Perfect for solo travelers aged 20-45. Explore Bangkok, Phuket, Krabi, Koh Phi Phi. Over 30 activities, adventure, culture, nightlife, expert guides. Book now!

tour_information.description: Join our 19-day Thailand group tour. Perfect for solo travelers aged 20-45. Explore Bangkok, Phuket, Krabi, Koh Phi Phi. Adventure, culture, nightlife, expert guides. Book now!

day1.title: Bangkok - Welcome Dinner
day1.desc: Let your Thailand adventure begin! We pick you up at the airport and head to your home for the next two days. Everyone gathers for the welcome gathering at 6 p.m. in the lobby. You'll then set off for a traditional Thai-style dinner followed by a night on Khao San Road. Arriving early? No problem. Spend the day shopping at Khao San Road (walking distance from the hotel) or soak up the sun by the hotel pool.

day2.title: Tuk Tuk, Temples & Thai Massage
day2.desc: Experience the best of the bustling city of Bangkok - an adrenaline rush to all five senses! You'll explore by boat, by foot, and by... tuk-tuk. Ride the riverboat along the mighty Chao Praya, wind through the city streets in a tuk-tuk, visit the must-see temples, and end with a one-hour traditional Thai massage. Spend the night with your new mates for Khao San Road Round II, or relax by the pool.

day3.title: Erawan National Park
day3.desc: Off to Erawan National Park for some serious bonding time around the fire. There will be sunset swims, fireside chats, a Thai-style BBQ, and a relaxing night camped out along the Khwae Yai River. Today also includes a visit to the iconic Death Railway, steeped in rich history made famous by the classic movie "The Bridge on the River Kwai" and free-time to roam a local market for lunch.

day4.title: Erawan's Seven Waterfalls!
day4.desc: Trek into the jungle and past the seven waterfalls of Erawan National Park as the emerald waters stream down from the hilltop. Photo opportunities abound, and there is no shortage of inviting pools where you can stop for a refreshing swim. This is truly an incredible experience and not one to be missed! You don’t have to trek all the way to the top, but the further you trek, the more brilliant the viewpoints become.

day5.title: Elephant Sanctuary: Trekking, Feeding & Mud Bath
day5.desc: This is one happy herd of elephants! We could not be more proud to support this group. This highly vetted, no-harness, no-chain, no-nonsense organization—spread out through Thailand, Cambodia, and Myanmar—rescues and rehabilitates everyone’s favourite pachyderms (as well as an array of other animals in need). Spend a full day walking, feeding, and bathing these beautiful creatures.

day6.title: Back to School & Cooking Lesson
day6.desc: We stop by a local Thai school to surprise the students and make their day—a new school on every tour to genuinely support and provide a special day for the students. We will help with school work, get in a game of football, or just sit down for a chat and make new friends to help improve their English. Next, we're heading to your next accommodation, a beautiful traditional Thai home along the river where you can relax and cook Thai food in your Thai cooking lesson!

day7.title: Thai Home: Floating Market & Monk Merit
day7.desc: Monks refrain from cooking, so we will offer them breakfast at sunrise. In return, they share merit, goodwill, and Buddha's teachings. Our adventure continues as we explore Thailand's iconic Amphawa Floating Market, where dozens of vibrant stalls offer everything from sweet grilled meats to unique, locally-made handicrafts and clothing—perfect for gifts. After soaking in the market's lively atmosphere, we'll visit the majestic Phra Pathom Chedi.

day8.title: Khao Sok: Floating Bungalows
day8.desc: Floating is the theme of the day! We head to the ever-stunning Khao Sok National Park for a day of kayaks and floating wooden bungalows. Your door is just steps from the crystal-clear waters of Cheow Lan Lake, surrounded by towering limestone formations wrapped in dense jungle. After the activities, sunbathing and floating beverages are suggested before we sit for a delicious family-style meal.

day9.title: Krabi: Free Time
day9.desc: Welcome to Krabi, home to Thailand's most famous and beautiful beaches. This sleepy beach town looks out over the teal-blue water of the Andaman Ocean and offers a variety of outdoor activities to enjoy.
