Our resort is just a minute's walk from the beach; there is a hotel bar - in the pool - and the nightlife leaves absolutely nothing to be desired! This is about as close to paradise as you get.

day10.title: Mangrove Kayak Adventure
day10.desc: Enjoy a guided paddle along the crystal-clear water of Krabi's surrounding jungle and hop in for some cool-down swims along the way. You will not believe how pristine and clear this emerald-coloured river is in real life. Then, free time by the pool or head down to the beach. Downtown Krabi is just a short walk away and offers plenty more to do if you wake up feeling active. You can make the rest of this day as active or relaxed as you wish.

day11.title: Railay Beach
day11.desc: Another day, another epic Thai beach. Only accessible by longtail boat, we get dropped off on the white sands of Railay Beach, surrounded by stunning limestone cliffs. This hidden paradise is surrounded by these mountainous formations, and the locals pull up their boats to serve a variety of Thai and Western lunch options. Rock climbing is optional but highly suggested.

day12.title: Tiger Cave Temple
day12.desc: Take a break from beach time and climb the 1,237 steps to the top of Tiger Cave Temple. You will be greeted by the dozens of families of monkeys that call this area home and a breathtaking view from the summit lookout point. Get up close and personal for some unique photo opportunities with these curious, jungle-dwelling mammals or step back and enjoy the show. After, we head back to the resort for some post-trek poolside relaxation and perhaps even some afternoon cocktails.

day13.title: Free Time in Krabi
day13.desc: Krabi is home to some of the best beaches in Thailand, and you have nearly a week to enjoy them. This sleepy beach town looks out over the teal-blue water of the Andaman Ocean and offers a variety of outdoor activities to enjoy. Our resort is just a minute's walk from the beach; there is a hotel bar - in the pool - and the nightlife leaves absolutely nothing to be desired! This is about as close to paradise as you get.

day14.title: Island Hopping: Maya Bay & More
day14.desc: We head out for some island hopping to visit some of Thailand's most beautiful islands. Your privately reserved speed boat brings you and your travel mates to all the must-see spots for a full day of adventure. Snorkel in the crystal clear water and enjoy a traditional Thai meal for lunch served on the boat's deck. The trip concludes on the stunning island of Koh Phi Phi Don, which you will call home for the next two nights.

day15.title: Phi Phi Island: View Point Trek
day15.desc: Relax and soak up the last of your time on Koh Phi Phi. Grab breakfast and a fruit shake, and take in the stunning place you just called home for three days. Don't worry; your Thailand beach time isn't over yet! We head back to the resort in Krabi for a couple more days of activities. Chill poolside, hit the beach, or explore the town by day—and don’t miss the epic pool party at the hostel tonight, complete with good vibes, music, and plenty of fun!

day16.title: Phi Phi Island
day16.desc: Time to get on that island time! Enjoy your free time on the picturesque island of Koh Phi Phi. Mingle with the many other backpackers who make their way to the island, set up on the beach, or take the hike to the lookout for one of the most iconic photo stops in all of Thailand. As the day winds down, we'll catch the ferry to Phuket, where your next adventure begins.

day17.title: Phuket: Patong Beach
day17.desc: Incredible beaches and wild nightlife collide on this vibrant island like no other. Welcome to Thailand's largest island, Phuket! (Pronounced: Poo-ket). We'll organise a beach trip. We have plenty of free time to go shopping. The day is yours to explore and enjoy.

day18.title: Free Time in Phuket
day18.desc: Phuket’s got a beach for every vibe, and today’s all yours to explore. Lounge by the hotel pool, hit up the island’s waterparks for some splashy fun, or dive into the local food scene at quirky cafes and bustling restaurants. Shopping? Plenty of that too—think street markets and shiny malls. Whether you’re chasing sunsets or good times, Phuket’s got you covered!

day19.title: Phuket: Until Next Time
day19.desc: Your Thailand tour is over, but the past 19 days will stick with you for a lifetime. You can use the hotel's facilities until your departure, including the pool and bag storage room. Get in one last breakfast together before you head to the airport. Your guide can arrange transfers to the International Airport in Phuket. Some will continue in their journey, while others will head back home. No matter your choice, this is hopefully the beginning of many future adventures!

seo_data.meta_title: 15 Day Small Group Tour in Vietnam | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: Join our 15-day Vietnam group tour! Highlights include Hanoi city exploration, Ha Long Bay overnight cruise, Tam Coc jungle trek, and Phong Nha's Dark Caves adventure. Book 2025/2026 now!

open_graph.title: 15 Day Northern Vietnam Group Tour with Mountains, Culture & Adventure | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: Join our 15-day Vietnam group tour! Highlights include Hanoi city exploration, Ha Long Bay overnight cruise, Tam Coc jungle trek, and Phong Nha's Dark Caves adventure. Book 2025/2026 now!

tour_information.description: Join our 15-day Vietnam group tour! Highlights include Hanoi city exploration, Ha Long Bay overnight cruise, Tam Coc jungle trek, and Phong Nha's Dark Caves adventure. Book 2025/2026 now!

day1.title: Meet & Greet
day1.desc: Your Vietnam adventure begins! Settle in at the hotel, meet the Vietnam tour guides, and get to know your travel mates before a complimentary welcoming dinner that samples Vietnam's most delicious dishes. Then, a night out in the ever-bustling streets of Hanoi.

day2.title: 1000 Year Old Sights In Hanoi
day2.desc: Take in the sights of Vietnam’s 1000-year-old capital city! Explore all the must-see sights of Hanoi including Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum, Ngoc Son Temple, and One Pillar Pagoda. Finish your day of exploring with the perfect post-sightseeing activity -- a one-hour, traditional Vietnamese massage.

day3.title: Hello, Halong Bay
day3.desc: Cruise on our privately reserved sleeper boat as we voyage through this breathtaking UNESCO World Heritage Site. Sunset cocktails from the top deck - just in time for happy hour - is a can't-miss experience. Sit down for a never-ending feast afterward that gives way to nighttime festivities including your first Vietnamese cooking lesson of the tour. Consider this something like a cocktail cruise with a world-class view.

day4.title: Halong Bay To Tam Coc
day4.desc: Good morning, Vietnam! Catch sunrise on the top deck with your morning cup of coffee before we set out to explore Halong's Thien Canh Son Cave. Then, enjoy a lunchtime feast aboard the boat before heading to Tam Coc to kick back and relax at our ever-welcoming countryside resort - pool table, fishing pond, and stunning scenery included.

day5.title: Lying Dragon Mountain & River Tour
day5.desc: Climb the 500 steps of Hang Mua - Lying Dragon Mountain - to the picturesque view of the elaborate system of mountains, caves, and rivers below. Unsurprisingly, this was once the choice spot of Vietnam's former King where he held days-long celebrations that included dancing, feasting, and drinking rice wine. Afterward, we cycle our way through ricefields before taking a ride down the river (and through the caves) in a traditional sampan boat.

day6.title: Primate Centre & Jungle Trek
day6.desc: Visit the Endangered Primate Rescue Centre and come face to face with some of the world’s most critically endangered primates! Many of these species have been pushed to the brink of extinction - some being one of less than 100 left in the entire world - making the work of this incredible rehabilitation organisation that much more important. But first, a jungle trek through the surrounding National Park. Then hop on the sleeper bus and wake up in the lazy town of Phong Nha.

day7.title: Free Time In Phong Nha
day7.desc: Explore the beauty of Phong Nha or post up by the hotel pool! This area is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and contains the oldest karst mountains in Asia - clocking in at over 400 million years old. There are many caves and waterfalls to explore for the restless. Paradise Cave is the longest cave is part of the longest cave system in the world and makes for an unforgettable day trip! For the not-so-restless, we suggest poolside beverages.

day8.title: The Dark Cave Experience
day8.desc: Ziplining, kayaking, and caving knee-deep in mud. What to expect? Start with the longest zipline in Vietnam before heading in for some fun in the mud. The natural mud bath is thousands of years old; you can even see ancient fossils on the cave walls. After your mud bath, kayak adventures before we finish with a refreshing swim, obstacle course above the water (optional but highly suggested), and float in the Chay River.

day9.title: Beach Time & Ancient Hue
day9.desc: Early bus down to Vietnam's Ancient Capital of Hue! En route, we stop off for a recharge with some much-needed beach time. Sunbathe, swim, and soak in the first of several beach stops on your journey. Then we weave our way into Hue for two nights in the centre of a historic, vibrant city. For evening times, there are many markets with much to explore, eat, and drink just near the hotel.

day10.title: Explore The Former Capital
day10.desc: For a century, Hue was the capital of Vietnam. Spend the day exploring the remnants and relics of those times at this UNESCO World Heritage Site, including the Imperial City and the Forbidden Purple City. Afterward, we volunteer some time at a local school to play games, help out with English-speaking lessons, and experience an entire different side of Vietnamese culture. Then, a Backpacking Tours exclusive experience as we stop at a local nunnery for a full vegan lunch prepared by the welcoming women who explain life here and their fascinating life stories. Finish up poolside with a beverage!

day11.title: Drive The Hai Van Pass to Hoi An
day11.desc: The Hai Van Pass: 19 kilometres of roadway that towers above the dramatic coastline of Central Vietnam. Jeremy Clarkson of the BBC's Top Gear praised this drive as "...a deserted ribbon of perfection -- one of the best coast roads in the world." Photo stops will be made! Plus, a pitstop for a swim and stretch at a little-known natural spring along the way with some of the most underrated views in all of Vietnam. Final destination: Hoi An - the City Of Lanterns.

day12.title: Free Time in Hoi An
day12.desc: Explore the uniqueness of this ancient port town and UNESCO World Heritage Site… or just enjoy the white sands and warm waters at An Bang Beach. Bamboo raft rides are also a cultural experience not to be missed. Time to hit the brakes on the bus rides and enjoy five days experiencing the eclectic charm of The City of Lanterns - Hoi An's well-deserved nickname. Chilling out at the hotel pool is also an option! But free time is your time - we suggest, you decide.

day13.title: Ricefield Cycle To An Bang Beach
day13.desc: Bike to the beach for some group bonding (and beach beverages). The quick, flat ride brings us through the vibrant city centre of Hoi An, through the rolling ricefields, to the sea. Catch some sun, rent a paddleboard, sample the local seafood, and enjoy Hoi An's most stunning beach. Not feeling beachtime? The tailor-made clothing is world-famous (and incredibly affordable) or you can just hang by the hotel pool.

day14.title: Live Like The Locals
day14.desc: Cycle through the ricefields to the organic farm for a day of unique cultural experiences with the farmers who call this home. Stop by a local farmer's market for an ingredient lesson, make rice paper from scratch, get in the garden alongside local farmers, and learn to make four mouth-watering Vietnamese dishes from scratch! And don't forget the well-deserved foot massage to finish off your day of adventure.

day15.title: Not Goodbye! Until Next Time
day15.desc: Enjoy a final breakfast together and say your goodbyes and until-next-times before heading to Danang airport or further on in your travels. Airport drop off is included in the tour and available throughout the day. The tour has finished but your Vietnam adventure will stay with you for a lifetime!

seo_data.meta_title: 12 Day Vietnam Small Group Tour | Backpacking Tours
seo_data.meta_description: Experience the best of Vietnam in 12 unforgettable days. From buzzing Hanoi to Ha Long Bay—this trip has it all. Led by an expert guide and joined by a crew of new travel mates, it’s the ultimate way to see Vietnam.

open_graph.title: 12 Day Express Adventure Tour in Vietnam with Cities, Food & Culture | Backpacking Tours
open_graph.description: Experience the best of Vietnam in 12 unforgettable days. From buzzing Hanoi to Ha Long Bay—this trip has it all. Led by an expert guide and joined by a crew of new travel mates, it’s the ultimate way to see Vietnam.

tour_information.description: Experience the best of Vietnam in 12 unforgettable days. From buzzing Hanoi to Ha Long Bay—this trip has it all. Led by an expert guide and joined by a crew of new travel mates, it’s the ultimate way to see Vietnam.
included_items: Flight from Hoi An to Ho Chi Minh
activities_incl: Overnight Boat Trip on Ha Long Bay

day1.title: Arrive in Hanoi
day1.desc: Touch down in Vietnam’s vibrant capital! We’ll be there to meet you at the airport and transfer you to the hotel. Settle in, meet your group and guide, and kick things off with a relaxed evening and optional welcome dinner with your new travel fam.

day2.title: Explore Hanoi
day2.desc: Dive into Hanoi’s buzzing energy with a walking and rickshaw tour of the Old Quarter. Wander through narrow streets packed with history, food stalls, and local life. Taste delicious Vietnamese street food and learn about the city’s culture and traditions. That evening, we’ll head out for dinner and drinks at some of the city's best local spots.

day3.title: Ha Long Bay Overnight Cruise
day3.desc: Today we hit the water with an unforgettable overnight cruise in Ha Long Bay. Cruise through emerald waters surrounded by limestone cliffs, kayak through hidden caves, and enjoy a freshly prepared seafood lunch onboard. Spend the evening watching sunset from the deck, followed by a night under the stars on our traditional Vietnamese boat.
activities_incl: Overnight Boat Trip on Ha Long Bay

day4.title: Ninh Binh Homestay
day4.desc: After breakfast, we journey south to Ninh Binh, also known as the ‘Halong Bay on land.’ Settle into a charming riverside homestay surrounded by rice fields and towering limestone peaks. Enjoy a laid-back afternoon, take in the views, and relax before dinner with your hosts.

day5.title: Bike Ride, River Cruise & Overnight Train
day5.desc: Cycle through lush countryside past rice paddies and grazing water buffalo. We’ll then hop in traditional boats to float along the river and through scenic caves. After climbing to the Dragon Mountain Viewpoint for panoramic views, we board the overnight sleeper train south to Hoi An.

day6.title: Arrive in Hoi An
day6.desc: We arrive in the UNESCO-listed town of Hoi An, known for its charm and colourful lanterns. Spend the day exploring at your own pace—visit tailor shops, grab a banh mi, or relax by the riverside. In the evening, stroll through the lantern-lit streets for a magical vibe.

day7.title: Crab Fishing & Cooking Class
day7.desc: Cruise through coconut groves in traditional basket boats and try your hand at crab fishing with local fishermen. Later, take part in a hands-on cooking class to learn how to whip up some Vietnamese favourites. Feast on your creations and chill out for the evening.

day8.title: Lantern Making & Beach Time
day8.desc: This morning, we’ll learn the ancient art of lantern making in a workshop guided by a local artisan. Then, it’s time to hit the beach. We’ll relax at a beach club, swim, and sip cocktails with a stunning sunset as the backdrop. Dinner and drinks by the ocean top off a perfect day.

day9.title: Fly to Ho Chi Minh City
day9.desc: Catch a short internal flight to Ho Chi Minh City. After checking in, you’ll have the afternoon free to explore bustling markets or chill at a rooftop café. Join the group later for dinner and optional nightlife adventures in this high-energy southern city.

day10.title: Mekong Delta Overnight
day10.desc: Today we head into the Mekong Delta, a lush region of winding rivers and rural villages. Cruise canals, visit local markets, learn about traditional crafts, and get a true feel for local life. We’ll stay overnight in a peaceful homestay and enjoy a home-cooked meal.

day11.title: Cu Chi Tunnels & Farewell Night
day11.desc: Head back to Ho Chi Minh City and stop at the Cu Chi Tunnels, a fascinating underground network used during the Vietnam War. Crawl through sections of the tunnels and hear powerful stories from the past. In the evening, we’ll celebrate our final night with a farewell dinner and drinks.

day12.title: Check Out & Onward Travel
day12.desc: Your Vietnam adventure wraps up today. Whether you’re flying home or continuing your travels, your group leader will be there to help with travel plans and goodbyes. Until next time!

tour_information.description: Join our 23-day Vietnam group tour! Over 30 activities, including island hopping in Nha Trang, cooking class in Hoi An, and a primate rescue centre in Tam Coc. Book your 2025/2026 trip now!

day1.title: Meet & Greet
day1.desc: Your Vietnam adventure begins! Settle in at the hotel, meet the BTV tour guides, and get to know your travel mates before a complimentary welcoming dinner that samples Vietnam's most delicious dishes. Then, a night out in the ever-bustling streets of Hanoi.

day2.title: 1000 Year Old Sights In Hanoi
day2.desc: Take in the sights of Vietnam’s 1000-year-old capital city! Explore all the must-see sights of Hanoi including Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum, Ngoc Son Temple, and One Pillar Pagoda. Finish your day of exploring with the perfect post-sightseeing activity -- a one-hour, traditional Vietnamese massage.

day3.title: Hello, Halong Bay
day3.desc: Cruise on our privately reserved sleeper boat as we voyage through this breathtaking UNESCO World Heritage Site. Sunset cocktails from the top deck - just in time for happy hour - is a can't-miss experience. Sit down for a never-ending feast afterward that gives way to nighttime festivities including your first Vietnamese cooking lesson of the tour. Consider this something like a cocktail cruise with a world-class view.

day4.title: Halong Bay To Tam Coc
day4.desc: Good morning, Vietnam! Catch sunrise on the top deck with your morning cup of coffee before we set out to explore Halong's Thien Canh Son Cave. Then, enjoy a lunchtime feast aboard the boat before heading to Tam Coc to kick back and relax at our ever-welcoming countryside resort - pool table, fishing pond, and stunning scenery included.

day5.title: Lying Dragon Mountain & River Tour
day5.desc: Climb the 500 steps of Hang Mua - Lying Dragon Mountain - to the picturesque view of the elaborate system of mountains, caves, and rivers below. Unsurprisingly, this was once the choice spot of Vietnam's former King where he held days-long celebrations that included dancing, feasting, and drinking rice wine. Afterward, we cycle our way through ricefields before taking a ride down the river (and through the caves) in a traditional sampan boat.

day6.title: Primate Centre & Jungle Trek
day6.desc: Visit the Endangered Primate Rescue Centre and come face to face with some of the world’s most critically endangered primates! Many of these species have been pushed to the brink of extinction - some being one of less than 100 left in the entire world - making the work of this incredible rehabilitation organisation that much more important. But first, a jungle trek through the surrounding National Park. Then hop on the sleeper bus and wake up in the lazy town of Phong Nha.

day7.title: Free Time In Phong Nha
day7.desc: Explore the beauty of Phong Nha or post up by the hotel pool! This area is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and contains the oldest karst mountains in Asia - clocking in at over 400 million years old. There are many caves and waterfalls to explore for the restless. Paradise Cave is the longest cave is part of the longest cave system in the world and makes for an unforgettable day trip! For the not-so-restless, we suggest poolside beverages.

day8.title: The Dark Cave Experience
day8.desc: Ziplining, kayaking, caving knee-deep in mud… you make this day as adventurous as you’d. What to expect? Start off with the longest zipline in Vietnam before heading in for some fun in the mud. The natural mud bath is thousands of years old and you can even see ancient fossils on the walls of the cave. After your mud bath, kayak adventures before we finish off with a refreshing swim, obstacle course above the water (optional but highly suggested), and float in the Chay River.

day9.title: Beach Time & Ancient Hue
day9.desc: Early bus down to Vietnam's Ancient Capital of Hue! En route, we stop off for a recharge with some much-needed beach time. Sunbathe, swim, and soak in the first of several beach stops on your journey towards Saigon. Then we weave our way into Hue for two nights in the centre of a historic, vibrant city. For evening times, there are many markets with much to explore, eat, and drink just near the hotel.

day10.title: Explore The Former Capital
day10.desc: For a century, Hue was the capital of Vietnam. Spend the day seeing the remnants and relics of those times at this UNESCO World Heritage Site -- such as the Imperial City and Forbidden Purple City. Afterward, we volunteer some time at a local school to play games, help out with English-speaking lessons, and experience an entire different side of Vietnamese culture. Then, a Backpacking Tours exclusive experience as we stop at a local nunnery for a full vegan lunch prepared by the welcoming women who explain life here and their fascinating life stories. Finish up poolside with a beverage!

day11.title: Drive The Hai Van Pass to Hoi An
day11.desc: The Hai Van Pass: 19 kilometres of roadway that towers above the dramatic coastline of Central Vietnam. Jeremy Clarkson of the BBC's Top Gear praised this drive as "...a deserted ribbon of perfection -- one of the best coast roads in the world." Photo stops will be made! Plus, a pitstop for a swim and stretch at a little-known natural spring along the way with some of the most underrated views in all of Vietnam. Final destination: Hoi An - the City Of Lanterns.

day12.title: Free Time in Hoi An
day12.desc: Explore the uniqueness of this ancient port town and UNESCO World Heritage Site… or just enjoy the white sands and warm waters at An Bang Beach. Bamboo raft rides are also a cultural experience not to be missed. Time to hit the brakes on the bus rides and enjoy five days experiencing the eclectic charm of The City of Lanterns - Hoi An's well-deserved nickname. Chilling out at the hotel pool is also an option! But free time is your time - we suggest, you decide.

day13.title: Ricefield Cycle To An Bang Beach
day13.desc: Bike to the beach for some group bonding (and beach beverages). The quick, flat ride brings us through the vibrant city centre of Hoi An, through the rolling ricefields, to the sea. Catch some sun, rent a paddleboard, sample the local seafood, and enjoy Hoi An's most stunning beach. Not feeling beachtime? The tailor-made clothing is world-famous (and incredibly affordable) or you can just hang by the hotel pool.

day14.title: Live Like The Locals
day14.desc: Cycle through the ricefields to the organic farm for a day of unique cultural experiences with the farmers who call this home. Stop by a local farmer's market for an ingredient lesson, make rice paper from scratch, get in the garden alongside local farmers, and learn to make four mouth-watering Vietnamese dishes from scratch! And don't forget the well-deserved foot massage to finish off your day of adventure.

day15.title: Last Day In 'The City Of Lanterns'
day15.desc: Maybe it's time for that coconut basket boat ride? Or maybe not. We offer a list of activity options for you to choose from. If you'd prefer some you time, we suggest meandering through Ancient Town or back to the beach you go to work on that holiday tan. Then, away we go on the sleeper bus to Nha Trang later this evening.

day16.title: Beach Day In Nha Trang
day16.desc: Our hotel is just a few minutes walk from one of the most beautiful beaches in Vietnam. Post up there, kick back at the hotel pool, or enjoy the rooftop views and grab some sun before the Nha Trang nightlife heats up. Free time activity options include: a visit to Vinpearl Land Waterpark - Vietnam's answer to Disney World (kind of) or a visit to the mud baths for a full-day hyrdotherapy extravaganza.

day17.title: Authentic Island-Hopping
day17.desc: Everyone loves a boat party, right? Snorkel Vietnam’s best reefs, eat like the locals, dive in from the top deck, stop by a meet the local fisherman, soak up some sun and get involved with the floating bar -- a true can’t miss experience. We stop off along the way at some secluded beaches and a full lunch is provided (included) aboard our private boat. Nha Trang is one of Vietnam's most tropical destinations and this day is spent exploring as much of that as possible.

day18.title: Dalat Waterfalls & Alpine Coasters
day18.desc: From the weather to the architecture, Dalat is unlike any other place in Vietnam! This mid-highlands city is also one of the best spots to visit some of Vietnam’s most stunning waterfalls. The Alpine Coaster brings you to the bottom of the falls in an adrenaline-filled ride down the face of the mountain and the short hike afterward provides big scenic rewards. Then, to the buzzing night market to explore what the locals consider the most romantic city in all of Vietnam.

day19.title: Seaside Beach Hostel
day19.desc: Morning bus from the lush highlands of Dalat to the bone-dry desert of Mui Ne! This Vietnam trip has it all. Chill out at our beachside resort and enjoy one of the last beach days on tour. Somewhere over the last three weeks and 1,700 kilometres of travelling, these complete strangers have become part of your new backpacker family. And you all deserve some rest and relaxation after all you've done. The beach is just a few steps from your door, the pool is first class, and the activity options are many.

day20.title: Sand Dunes Sunrise
day20.desc: Wake up for sunrise over Phan Thiet’s sprawling White Dunes - one of those surreal places on the Vietnam tour where the desert meets the sea. Take the short walk to the top of the dunes for the sunrise, sand sled the Red Dunes, visit the enchanting Fairy Stream (also known as the Little Grand Canyon), and stop by a local fishing village. Then you'll need to make the hard decisions: Post up poolside or head to the beach - or both? This is your final beach day on tour and there's no wrong answers here.

day21.title: Bright Lights Of Saigon
day21.desc: Morning bus to the buzzing city of Saigon! Spend the day checking out the sights and enjoy a last remaining family dinner (always optional) before heading out into the city for a night out. The hotel is located in a bustling backpacker district where the neon nightlife and near-endless restaurants are never more than a few steps from the door. Expect dancing, singing, drinking, and more dancing on one of the last days together on this Vietnam trip with your crew of new lifelong mates.
